title: Ticket #2417: collector dies when reading offline ads lacking MyType and TargetType
description:
When ads missing TargetType and MyType are written to the offline log, an illegal entry is made in the log that causes the collector to die when it starts up and tries to read the log.

The bad entry looks like this: 

   101 <slot1@exec-1.batlab.org,128.104.100.28>

An ad without this problem looks like this: 

   101 <slot1@exec-1.batlab.org,128.104.100.28> Machine Job
remarks:
2011-Aug-24 16:27:29 by danb:
The collector now inserts placeholders in the offline log for empty MyType and TargetType, so ads lacking these attributes are no longer unreadable when it reads them back in from the offline log.

In keeping with existing practice, we do not attempt to distinguish between the case where MyType and/or TargetType are undefined vs. an empty string.

2011-Aug-24 16:18   Check-in [26961]: Documented fix for offline ads lacking MyType and/or TargetType. ===GT=== #2417 ===VersionHistory=== All Complete (By Dan Bradley )
2011-Aug-24 16:18   Check-in [26960]: Fixed problem with offline ads that contain no MyType or TargetType. ===GT:Fixed=== #2417 (By Dan Bradley )
